# seal

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Near_Eastern_seals_and_sealing_practices  

Bulla seal 8th millennium BC onwards

The Halaf culture saw the earliest known appearance of [stamp](stamp.html) seals in the Near East, first made in the 4th millennium BC, and probably earlier. 

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Stamp_seal_with_Master_of_Animals_motif%2C_Tello%2C_ancient_Girsu%2C_End_of_Ubaid_period%2C_Louvre_Museum_AO14165.jpg/440px-Stamp_seal_with_Master_of_Animals_motif%2C_Tello%2C_ancient_Girsu%2C_End_of_Ubaid_period%2C_Louvre_Museum_AO14165.jpg)

Cylinder seals appeared first around 3600 bc in southern Mesopotamia and south-western Iran

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Musicians_portrayed_on_pottery_found_at_Chogha_Mish_archeological_site.jpg/400px-Musicians_portrayed_on_pottery_found_at_Chogha_Mish_archeological_site.jpg) 

ğ“‹´ ğ“‘ ğ“ ğ“…± ğ“‹©||seal| signature < Siegel signal  sign  
ğ“‹´ ğ“‘ ğ“„¿ ğ“‡‹ ğ“‡‹ ğ“ ğ“‹©||seal|szaiiith â‡” Zeichen  
ğ“‹´ ğ“‘ ğ“„¿ ğ“‡‹ ğ“‡‹ ğ“ ğ“‹©||seal|certificate  


Syrian [stamp](stamp.html) [seal](seal.html)s developed into iconography of elaborate rituals during the late [Ubaid](Ubaid.html) and early [Uruk](Uruk.html) period in [Susa](Susa.html)  
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pannous/images/main/susa_stamp_seals.jpg)  

[Stamp](Stamp.html) seals were prominent in the Halaf culture, in Anatolia and the Zagros mountains before descending into the southwest Ubaid, where they were transformed into cylinder seals
